about_the_game:
The Little Clandestine is the continuation of the story narrated in Dirty Wars - September 11 by UglyCat Studios, an emotional 2D top-down adventure that invites you to experience the Cold War in South America during the late '70s and '80s through the eyes of Pipo, a Chilean child from a fractured family who enters a clandestine life in a world of struggle and resistance against the military dictatorship in Chile.

                                             

                                                                        Pipo

Main Features:

  • Unique Graphic Style: The game features a graphic style inspired by posters and art from the '70s, with meticulous details that recreate the atmosphere of the time. From poor neighborhoods to the grand avenues of Santiago de Chile, each scene is designed with a retro touch.

  • Stats: Complete missions and minigames within a system where experience and money management merge with the gameplay levels as ages in Pipo's life.

  • Interactive Inventory: Throughout the game, collect, gift, or trade objects through the inventory system. These objects not only have functional value but also contribute to the story's development and Pipo's growth. Every item you obtain and every decision you make will influence Pipo's life and how he interacts with other characters.

  • Minigames: Challenges that take you through different neighborhoods and customs of a Latin American child during the '80s to enhance the life experience.

  • Achievements and Replayability: Take different paths to reach the central points of the story, discovering different angles, challenges, and achievements, with the option for replayability through autosave in game slots.

  • Deep Narrative and Historical Context: Explore the impact of the Cold War in South America through the life of a child, his daily life, and growth.

  • Original Soundtrack: The game's soundtrack, composed by Giorgiost, the same composer of Dirty Wars - September 11, blends melancholic melodies and sounds that evoke the '70s and '80s, with a childlike feature that evolves as the character grows in the story.

Join Pipo on this historical journey as he learns to live in a world full of contradictions and unique challenges, all wrapped in a captivating graphic style and an unforgettable soundtrack!
